pageContext.claim: “I'm not talking about all media, but I'm talking about a hell of a lot of it; it is totally dishonest, it's incredible. For instance, you'll see stories on Sean Hannity, or Laura Ingraham, or Tucker Carlson, or Lou Dobbs, or Fox and Friends in the morning, revealing a major scandal [committed by liberals], and it won't be picked up by one paper.”
pageContext.analysis: This is misleading. The media in general is not dishonest. When there is an error in a story, the news organization issues a correction.
